results.title: Discovering aromatherapy
results.brief_description: An inspiring and easy to follow program which outlines the history of essential oils. Explores what aromatherapy is and examines the various ways it can be utilised to enhance quality of life. Includes information on sinusitus, hayfever, tension and stress, headaches, insomnia, PMT-pre-menstrual tension, burns, cuts, grazes, insect bites, travel sickness, arthritis and rheumatism, strains, sprains, childhood ailments, pets and beauty treatments. PLEASE NOTE THAT THE CONTENTS OF THIS VIDEO ARE FOR INFORMATION PURPOSES ONLY AND READ THE DISCLAIMER AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PROGRAM.

results.title: Discovering American folk music
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Reviews two main influences on the development of American folk music. Traces the history of one ballad from its original British version to its emergence in the West as the cowboy song, “Streets of Laredo”, and later in an African American blues version, “The St James Infirmary”.

results.title: Discovering a rainforest
results.creator_credit: Kenyon Castle, John Mabey and Rhonda Mabey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
The first part of the Australian continent to be touched by the morning sun is the sentinel peak of Mt. Warning, the core of an ancient volcano. In the eroded valleys and rugged mountain ranges that surround the peak are some of the world’s most beautiful rainforests, just a short journey from Surfers Paradise, Australia’s tourist playground. Sandwiched between the ocean and the outer rim of the volcano exists an incredible pot pourri of people and lifestyles.

results.title: Discoveries
results.brief_description: Chaos, jealousy, violence, anger and fear - childhood emotions experienced by Angela as she compares her life to the game of soccer. Angela is the soccer ball, her parents the two opposing teams - and no-one is the winner in this game of life, especially Angela. But she is playing her own game now and nothing will stop her - not even Brazil.

results.title: Discover Sweden
results.creator_credit: Dag Bengtsson, Journal Films, D Tranword Communications and J
results.brief_description: Provides a general introduction to the social geography of Sweden. Presents visual and factual information on landscape, industries, transport and settlement, banking systems, politics, and education. Focuses on the country’s people describing the sports they enjoy, their religion and social customs. Useful for regional studies of Europe. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Discover Australia's national parks
results.brief_description: Shows what to see and do in Australia’s National Parks, their location and the facilities available for visitors. This film shows Port Campbell, Wyperfeld, Mt. Buffalo and Wilson’s Promontory National Parks - all in Victoria. Narrated by Robert Raymond.

results.title: Discover America
results.creator_credit: Reid H Ray and Reid Ray Films
results.brief_description: The United States from the air, mostly filmed from a helicopter. The scenes are varied - the Statue of Liberty, the Grand Canyon, the Rockies, Las Vegas, Disneyland and the volcanic Mount Pelee in Hawaii. Also shows other sites of historical interest. Excellent photography by David Butler. Narrated by Meredith Burgess.

results.title: Disco
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
This film considers social and sexual expectations and attitudes of teenagers attending a disco. Their perceptions of male and female roles, the similarities and differences are portrayed through their behaviour, conversation and dress. Cinematography by Mike Edols.

results.title: Disclosure
results.creator_credit: Amy Scholder, Avram Finklestein, Sam Feder, Sofia Midon, Disclosure Film, Field of Vision and Bow + Arrow Entertainment
results.brief_description: An investigation of how Hollywood’s fabled stories have deeply influenced how Americans feel about transgender people, and how transgender people have been taught to feel about themselves.

constellations_other.name: Welcome to Chechnya: tales through time
constellations_other.description: Documentary Welcome to Chechnya used ground-breaking deep fake technology to hide the identities of LGBTQ+ people fleeing a government-orchestrated genocide in Chechnya.
